newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell sharply to 725 million yuan from 2.468 billion yuan with the 20-day contract the most actively traded.

Traders said trading was very dull on Friday due to a series of factors including a recent re-affirmation by the central bank that money traded on the interbank market must not flow into the stock markets.

"The central bank early last month re-affirmed the ban on interbank market money flowing into the stock markets, making many securities houses reduce their trading on the interbank market," one trader said.
Some traders said the market was still in a holiday mood after Hong Kong's return to China, so there was only sporadic borrowing and selling on the market on Friday.
Other traders said banks usually traded less on Fridays ahead of weekend, helping to depress volume today.
Traders said they believed the interbank rates would move in a narrow range with turnover recovering early next week.
